Getting Started

In HTML do the following:


<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="dialog.css">
<script src="dialog.js"></script>

To create a basic information dialog:


let dialog = new Dialog();
dialog.Info("This is a test.");
Example

To create a basic information dialog:


let dialog = new Dialog();
dialog.Error("Sorry, there was an error.  Please try again.");
Example

To create a basic warning dialog:


let dialog = new Dialog();
dialog.Warning("If you continue, there will be consequences.");
Example

Canned dialog algorithms Info(), Error() and Warning() can be customized using the explicit, or long, argument form. In fact, all of three of these are just invocations of the Dialog class Message() method. Here is an identical implementation of the Warning() method using the long argument form and the Message() method:


let dialog = new Dialog();
dialog.Message
(
	{
		Title: 'Warning', 
		Icon: 'warning',
		Content: '<p>If you continue, there will be consequences.</p>',
		Width: 400, 
		Height: 200,
		Buttons:
		[
			{Name: 'OK', Function: dialog.Close},
		],
		OnClose: dialog.Close,
	}
);

Icon specifies the icon image to show on the left hand side. Valid values are "info", "question", "error" and "warning". Alternatively, you can specify a path to an image.

OnClose defines a function to be called when the header bar close button is clicked.

To create a scrolling text dialog:


let dialog = new Dialog();
dialog.ScrollText
(
	{
		Title: 'Lorem Ipsum Scrolling Text',
		Content: '<p style="margin-top: 0px;">Long text goes here ...</p>',
	}
);
Example

Use the Launch() method to create a custom dialog (with all available options):


let dialog = new Dialog();
dialog.Launch
(
	{
		Title: 'Custom Dialog',
		Width: 500,
		Height: 400,
		Content: '<p>Content goes here.</p>',
		Buttons:
		[
			{Name: 'Test', Function: function(){alert('You clicked "Test".'); dialog.Close();}},
			{Name: 'Exit', Function: dialog.Close},
		],
		OnClose: dialog.Close,
	}
);
Example

Launch() differs from Message() in that it does not render a left hand side image.
